org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.core.io

Class AbstractWebSocketConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.io.AbstractConnection
      • org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.core.io.AbstractWebSocketConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Connection, BaseConnection, BaseConnection.SuspendToken, OutgoingFrames
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WebSocketClientConnection, WebSocketServerConnection

    public abstract class AbstractWebSocketConnection
extends AbstractConnection
implements BaseConnection, BaseConnection.SuspendToken, OutgoingFrames
    Provides the implementation of WebSocketConnection within the framework of the new Connection framework of jetty-io

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.core.api.BaseConnection

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Connection

        Performs a logical close of this connection.

        For simple connections, this may just mean to delegate the close to the associated EndPoint but, for example, SSL connections should write the SSL close message before closing the associated EndPoint.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Connection
        Specified by:
        close in interface BaseConnection
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractConnection
        See Also:
        StatusCode, BaseConnection.close(int, String)

      • close

        public void close(int statusCode,
         String reason)
        Description copied from interface: BaseConnection
        Send a websocket Close frame, with status code.

        Advanced usage: results in an non-blocking async write, then connection close.

        Specified by:
        close in interface BaseConnection
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the status code
        reason - the (optional) reason. (can be null for no reason)
        See Also:
        StatusCode

        public List<ExtensionConfig> getExtensions()
        Get the list of extensions in use.

        This list is negotiated during the WebSocket Upgrade Request/Response handshake.

        Returns:
        the list of negotiated extensions in use.
